turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Where's the air conditioning?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I don't know, Sonny ... on the roof somewhere I guess.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Do you think we can turn it on?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Are we going to get the ball rolling?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What are you talking about?  What do you think I'm doin'?  I'm gettin' the ball rollin'.  I'm keeping these people happy ... I'm keeping you happy ... I gotta keep the cops cooled out ... I gotta do everything ... I gotta pay for the pizza ... I'm workin' on it, do you know what I mean?  I'm workin' on it ... Jesus Christ!  I gotta do it all ... I got all the ideas ... you want me to give you the gun?  You want to take it over?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I'm okay ... I'm okay ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You know more than the Doctor? You're not okay, look at you.  Come on ...  ... let's get him out ...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I'm not going.  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey!  I'm tryin' to help you.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I stay here.  Damn it.  I just needed the insulin.  I'm used to it. Go on.  Go on.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You tell me.  Is he endangering his health, because if you tell me he is, I'll get him out.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I'll be God damned if you will.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!  You want to be a martyr or a hero or what?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'll never see them again, Mister Mulvaney.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: They look like good kids.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They're like any others but they're special to me.  You got kids?  You told me; you got two.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Special to me, too.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You like me?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Sure - we like you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: No you don't.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: You seem like a likable enough guy. It's hard to judge.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You know, I don't know him very well - but he's not gay ... and he's not going back to prison ... One time when he was in prison, they gang-banged him; 13 years old and eight guys gave it to him ... So Sal isn't goin' back to prison, no way.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You know ... I like you people ... I really do.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: We like you, too.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You know - I had a job once.  I used to work in a bank.  I had been training ... I used to have a boss ... Mr. Don Frio ... he wore a toupee ... I wonder if you'd hire me if I came in here and asked you for a job ...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Would I hire you?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Mister Mulvaney?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Are you a lawyer?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: No.  I had some legal training, but...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want to dictate my will.  I need a notary?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You got Bank Americard?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: What now, Sonny?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Listen, I owe a couple hundred dollars!  I don't wanta leave owing anybody anything!  A clean slate, a new leaf...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: What is it, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Everything's all right?  You okay?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Yeah, just a cigarette got in a wastebasket.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Little smoke: like a Polish four- alarm fire, is all.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.  Well, you're okay?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Yeah, thanks for keeping an eye out.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Thanks again, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm glad it's okay.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: It's okay. [Regards to the family, Sam.]

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: It's up to you ladies.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Howard!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Hey, girls -- I was on television...

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: What about Howard?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: I didn't eat any pizza.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I told you, he's got diabetes.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I wish somebody would tell me I'm gonna live long enough for it to be a habit.  My parent, she'll be okay. My husband, he'll be okay.  I even know who the bum is gonna marry. Terrific.  She'll take good care of him.

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: Girls, I wanta apologize.  For my language back there.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Ah, Sonny!  Good luck, you know?

turns.speaker: MULVANEY
turns.text: You were terrific, too!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Hey.  It's raining.

turns.speaker: NEWSMAN
turns.text: How did you know your son was involved?

turns.speaker: PAULINE
turns.text: It was on the TV.

turns.speaker: NEWSMAN
turns.text: When was the last time you saw Sal?

turns.speaker: PAULINE
turns.text: Oh, a long time.  Because I kept asking my husband where the heck could Junior be?  He wasn't around here.  I thought maybe he was in prison or some place.

turns.speaker: NEWSMAN
turns.text: Did you know he was a homosexual?

turns.speaker: PAULINE
turns.text: No, not until after they killed him.

turns.speaker: NEWSMAN
turns.text: Did you always call him Junior.

turns.speaker: PAULINE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NEWSMAN
turns.text: Do you remember anything else about Sal?

turns.speaker: PAULINE
turns.text: No, that's all.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You don't smoke ... why do you want to start now.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Because I'm scared, that's why. You never smoked?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I used to, but I stopped.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You stopped?  Why?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Because I don't want cancer.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You don't want cancer?  You're about to get your head blown off, you're worried about cancer.  Gimme the cigarette.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: No!  I'm not kidding.  Don't you understand?  You're pure!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Pure?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You shouldn't start now.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: For God's sake!  As soon as I'm outta this bank robbery, I'm gonna stop ... okay?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Go ahead.  Do what you want to do. I hate to see you break a perfect record.  You oughta take care of your body.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: My body?  What for?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Your body is the temple of the Lord.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You're serious!

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You're really pure, you know?  You got a perfect record.  You never used that stuff to ruin your body, why start now?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: You know, you remind me of my 19- year-old brother - only he's got his hair down to his knees - he looks like something that eats berries and roots out of the ground. God forbid I should say something to him like, 'Listen, if you ever smoke marijuana, just remember that it's illegal' and he storms outta the house.  You rob a bank, but you keep your body pure, is that it?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You gonna smoke the cigarette?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, for christ's sake... now... fuckin' asshole...  He can't make it.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Fuck him - let him out!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Ah, Jesus...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Let's go, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What are you crying for?  Jesus Christ.  It's not your fault there's no money...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: He's gone?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah - it's all right... let's go.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Where's the money?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Get 'em in the vault!

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Goddamn women...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Ah shit.  Okay... go ahead.  Anybody else have to go?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's the cops.  Shit!

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: How'd that happen?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You mean that?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: ... The bodies out the door.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want him to think that.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: But do you mean it?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal, I'm sorry about this.  But we can get outta this thing.  There's a way outta this.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Are you serious?  About throwin' a body outta here if we have to?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, I stalled him for a while. When it comes the time, then we'll work it out.  Okay?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: But do you mean in? ... But you just told him that if worse comes to worse...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want him to think that.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: But I want to know what you think.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: We won't have to.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I'll tell you right now - that I'm ready to do it.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He wants one.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Dead or alive?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Alive.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: To show that we're negotiating.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: All right ... send them the guard.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right ... let's go.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay, Sal ... what do we do?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I figure maybe we can get the FBI to make a deal ...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: What kind of a deal?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Maybe we can get outta this thing alive ... get 'em to drop the kidnapping charges ...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: What do you mean?  You talkin' about coppin a plea?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: ... because if you're talking about coppin' a plea, I'm tellin' you right now, there's no deal ... I'm never going back to prison ... We got our own deal already ... Do you remember the pact we made?  You and me and Jackie - that night in the bar ... we were talkin' about if we get trapped in the bank, what are you gonna do ... Right?  What did we say?  What did we say!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: We'd kill ourselves.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Does that still go?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: We're not there yet.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You realize, Sal, that we're gonna get outta the country, so if you wanna talk to somebody, do it now ... You gotta Mother or a Father? Friends?  If we gotta be outside the country, where do you wanna go?  Any country. Just name a country.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Wyoming.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Wyoming ... That's not out of the country -- that's in the United States ... Look, I'll be back.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Sonny -

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I never been up in a plane before.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's nothing - it just goes up - it's the safest thing in the world. Safer than a car.  Don't worry about it, Sal - it'll be all right ... they're great ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: They're trying to come through the door!

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Everybody!  Back here!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay ... okay ... all right, Sal, it's okay.  I got everything straightened out ... it's gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Get over there!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Look, I talked to him and it's not going to be a helicopter - they can't land on top of the roof - so they're comin' with a big ... limousine bus and they'll take us to the airport - and they're gonna get a jet ... so things are rollin' ... they're movin' ... I also ordered some food ... I got some pizzas for us, all right?  I got some things to drink - I got sodas ... I even asked them for aspirins ... I'm doin' what I can ... now I gotta pay for the pizza ... where are the marked bills?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: They keep sayin' two homosexuals. I'm not a homosexual.  I want you to stop them saying that.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: That's all they're interested in - it's a freak show to them.  I can't control it, Sal - let'em say what they want.  Forget it.  It don't matter.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's the FBI.  He wants to come in.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Have him walk in backwards.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Sal?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: They gotta stop sayin' that.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He was talkin' about arrangements ... we were talkin' about the TV.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Why couldn't he talk about that here?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He was showin' me how the airport bus is comin' in, like that, Sal.  What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, Sal ... How you doin'?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Just give me a receipt.  Hey, Sal, you okay?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Okay, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: There it is, Sal.  Sal?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!  Hey.  How about food? I forgot to ask to have food on board.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Hey, Sonny - You did it!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Let's move it, goddamn it.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: First off, get the lights back on and the air conditioning.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: No more favors.  That's all over, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Aw, Jesus ... you been doin' us favors all night!

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I've got a jet.  I'll have airport limousine here in a half hour.  I want the hostages.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I'd like to work with you on this, not against you.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Well, Jesus, these hostages are keeping me alive.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: Okay, when do I get them?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: At the airport.  We get on the plane, check it out, and if it's all okay we'll send them out. Except one.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I want them all.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I want to talk to Leon.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I want to come in, and see if everybody's okay.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You got guts.  You think if Sal and me have cut their throats we're gonna let you out?

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I have to see.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Jesus, you'd like to kill me, too.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I wouldn't like to, but I will, if I have to.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Nothin' personal, huh?  The man that kills me, I want him to do it because he hates my guts.  Not because it's a job.  Okay, let's go ... but you gotta walk in backwards.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Nobody give their right name ... it's the FBI!

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I just want to see all you young ladies are all all right in here.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Wait a minute!  What the fuck you tryin' to tell me?

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: What I said.  You just sit quiet and we'll handle Sal.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: The manager, he's diabetic, he's lookin' bad.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: Sonny!  Could you come out, please? Could you come out, please?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: It's my mother.  Who needs this shit?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't want him.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: What can he do, he's clean...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Gimme the black guy...

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: I can't allow that, Sonny...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You can't allow!  I'm running this thing, what gives you the idea you can say shit?  Come on.  I'll pay you.  Whatta you want?  Two hundred?  A thousand?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay - you got your one.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: You follow my car.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: That's the jet.  You give us one more, now.  That's the deal...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay.  Which one goes?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I ain't eaten all day.  I just realized it.

turns.speaker: SHELDON
turns.text: We'll have hamburgers on the plane. You ready?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay, who's the head teller here?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Open this up!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Listen, we got young girls here... you could watch your language.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I speak what I feel.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Listen, I'll never make it.  I'll have to go to the toilet.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What's the matter... they never housebroke you?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: It's not a joke.  I got this terrible fear of being locked in...

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Oh - Maria!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Who the hell is that?  God damn it! What the...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What are you trying to pull?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: I forgot she's in here.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Come on, nobody's going to the bathroom - come on...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh, shit!  I gotta have time to think.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: What is it?  Did you just barge in here... He doesn't have plan.  It's all a whim.  'Rob a bank!  What not?'

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: ... Just give me time to think...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, you okay?

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: He's got diabetes.  He's not a well person.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Those bastards -- they poisoned the pizza!  Sal - you didn't eat any pizza!?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: My kids ... Kimmy and Jimmy.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: They're beautiful ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Hey, let's get ready!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Sonny - Here's your document.

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Here's your document, Sonny.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah - it looks real official.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Fuck!  We did it!

turns.speaker: SYLVIA
turns.text: Goodbye, honey.  Wish us luck!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What do you want here, Ma?  You could of watched it on TV.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: My God, Sonny - you oughtta see - Alla Brooklyn is here!  On all 3 networks!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Mom - I got it all worked out; it's over.  The best thing is you go home.  Watch it on TV.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: I talked to the FBI, I told them about you, they said if you just come outta the bank it's gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: You did what?  Who did you talk to? What for?

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: Well, I'm only trying to get you outta this.  I told them you were in Vietnam, you always had good jobs, you were with Goldwater at the '64 convention, but you had marital problems...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh my God, mother!

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: I said you were never a faggot.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Don't talk to them anymore.  Sal and me are getting a jet, we're going to Algeria - I'll write you from there.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: He was very understanding - you ought to talk to him ... Algeria?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: We can't stay here.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: Oh my God!  I don't understand.  If you needed money, why couldn't you come to me?  Everything I got is yours.  I got two hundred and maybe twenty-five in the savings.  It's yours.  You know it.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Mom - they're sending a bus to take us to the airport.  You understand? If you're here - they're not gonna send it.  They'll think I'm gonna come out with you.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: What's wrong with that?  The FBI was very understanding when I explained it to him.  Everybody knows it isn't you ... It's the pressures from your home life.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: For God's sake don't start in on Heidi again ...

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: Did I say a thing against her?  God forbid I should say anything against that fat cunt.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Mom.  Mom.  There are some things a mother shouldn't say in front of her son.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: If she comes down here, so help me I'm gonna mash her brains in. Everything in your life was sunlight and roses until you met her.  Since then, forget it.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: She doesn't have anything to do with it!  You understand that? Mother?  This is me!

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: I know you wouldn't need Leon if Heidi was treating you right.  The thing I don't understand is why you come out and sleep with Heidi anyway?  You got two kids on welfare now.  What're you goin' to bed with her, you don't have enough with one wife and two kids on welfare, you want a wife and three kids on welfare?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Not now, Mom, please.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: What'll you do?  Come out.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I can't, Mom.  If I come out Sal will kill them.

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: Oh.  Run.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: What the hell for?  Twenty-five years in the pen?

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: Maybe...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Maybe!  Aw Christ, what dreams you live on!  Maybe what?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I'm a fuckup and an outcast.  There isn't one single person in my life I haven't hurt through my love. You understand that?  I'm the most dangerous person in the world, because if I love you, watch out, you're gonna get fucked, fucked over and fucked out!

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Did Pop come down?

turns.speaker: VI
turns.text: No.  This really pissed him off, Sonny.  He says you're dead.  He says he doesn't have a son.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: He's right.  You shoulda done what he did.  Go home.  Don't talk to the FBI anymore.

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Doing what?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: Robbing a bank.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't know ... It's where they got the money.  I mean, if you want to steal, you go to where they got the money, right?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: But I mean, why do you need to steal?  Couldn't you get a job?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Get a job doing what?  You gotta be a member of a union, no union card - no job.  To join the union, you gotta get the job, but you don't get the job without the card.

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: What about, ah, non-union occupations?

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Like what?  Bank teller?  What do they get paid -  ... they pay one hundred thirty- five dollars and thirty-seven cents to start.  I got a wife and kids. I can't live on that -- You want to live on that?  What do you make a week?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: I'm here to talk to you, Sonny, not ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Wait a minute ... I'm talkin' to you.  I'm askin' you a question ...

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: The audience is interested in you, Sonny ... not me.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Yeah!  We're hot entertainment, right?  You got me and Sal on TV ... we're entertainment you sell, right?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: You're news, Sonny ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: How much you have to pay an entertainer to fill this slot?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: Newsman, not ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Okay, newsman.  How much you make a week?  You're not talkin'.  You payin' me? What have you got for me?  We're givin' you entertainment ... what are you givin' us?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: What do you want us to give you? You want to be paid for ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: I don't want to be paid.  I'm here with Sal and eight other people ... and we're dyin'!  They're gonna blow our guts out, man!  You're gonna see our brains onna sidewalk! How's that for all you shut-ins and housewives to look at!  You gonna help, or you just put it on instead of AS THE WORLD TURNS?  We're dyin' here!  What have you got for me?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: You could give up.

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Give up?  You ever been in prison?

turns.speaker: TV NEWSMAN
turns.text: Of course not ...

turns.speaker: SONNY
turns.text: Then talk about somethin' you fuckin' know about ...

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: This is Drake Bishop.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Mr. Bishop... this is Claremont Williams. I own the Williams Brothers armored car service.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: What happened to my money, Mr. Williams? INT. CLAREMONT WILLIAMS III BOND AGENCY -- NEXT Claremont sits behind his desk with his phone to his ear.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Yesterday I received an e-mail from a source. In this e-mail were four social security numbers linked to the gentlemen who presented counterfeit California driver's licenses to my company late last night.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Well... I think that these are the gentlemen who robbed us. I'm also a bail bondsman out of Los Angeles. I can track down and deliver these crooks to you... for a small finder's fee of course.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: And if you can't deliver them?

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: My theft insurance policy will have to fork over the ten million... but that will take six to eight months due to Nevada state law. But you should know sir... that I employ bounty hunters. My bounty hunters can find these thieves.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: This is Bishop.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: The Bounty Hunters have arrived. They will drop off the money in exactly one hour. Where do you want to meet?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Top of the World at the Stratosphere. It's completely secure. INT. FBI JET -- NEXT Cosgrove and Espinoza listen to this conversation.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Holy shit... this bitch is fierce.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I've been training since I was twelve. Knives. Guns. Throwing stars. You name it... I can fight with it. I'm a hard worker and a fast learner.  Nothing scares me. I'm not afraid to die.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Morning.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Morning.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: They can do subtitles.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Choco grew up on the streets of El Salvador. When he was four years old... he stabbed another kid in the eye-ball with a pencil. There were wires crossed somewhere in his soul.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Who the hell is that?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: That's the crew. They follow us.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: What is it, Choco?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: I LOVE YOU, DOMINO.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I once vowed never to invest too much emotion into anyone, anything.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Alright. Time to ditch this thing. Did you take a look at the bathroom window?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: I forgot.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: For the love of God. Not Spanish again. Who's the girl?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: On a raid. If she wants to see justice... we gonna take Domino to the Jungle, baby. EXT. JUNGLE -- NEXT The El Camino pulls into the entrance to the JUNGLE. The neighborhood of LOW INCOME HOUSES winds upward into the HILLSIDE adjacent to the wall. Ed parks the El Camino next to the curb. INT. EL CAMINO -- NEXT

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bail jumper's name is Cookie Kincaid. Nineteen years old. His mommie posted bail when he was arrested for allegedly partaking in a drive-by shooting in Hawthorne.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: He killed two children.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Fella takes out two kids and has the audacity to not show up for trial.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: We gotta bring him in.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Will you speak the fucking English language? The poor girl has no clue what you're talking about.  The boy speaks English, you know. Reads, writes, I swear it. He does this when he's around girls. Thinks it's cute.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: I'm gonna kill you, Ed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tell him it's not cute. Will you tell him, Domino!?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Chinga te y tu mama tambien.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Jesus Christ! What's that smell?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: The children like to urinate in the balls.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Fuckin' A! We got a five hour drive back to LA ahead of us. EXT. MACDONALD'S -- PARKING LOT -- MOMENTS LATER Choco is now stripped down to his boxer shorts in the back PARKING LOT of the MacDonald's. Alf is hosing him down. Domino stares at Choco... admiring his body.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Fella could get used to a life this ordinary.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Maybe you should fuck her mom then.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about, did you fuck her?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I just charged $12.95 to our room for that movie. Now I'll never know how the story ends.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Don't fuck with me, Ed. Not you, not tonight.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh! And another thing. I am a liar. A pathological liar. There was no day in Danang, no multiple tours in Nam. Just lies to get laid, lies to get respect.  Truth is... I'm scared shitless all the time.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: What about your toe?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Anything to get the fuck out of dodge.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: Did it hurt?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you think, dumbshit?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Promise me... you won't ever tell Domino.

turns.speaker: CHOCO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Promise me... you won't tell her... that I never fucked Pat Benatar.

turns.speaker: CIGLIUTI
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: KEG PRESIDENT
turns.text: Mr. Cigliuti?

turns.speaker: CIGLIUTI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KEG PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm calling from the Kappa Epsilon Gamma house at California University.

turns.speaker: CIGLIUTI
turns.text: Yes. INT. KEG HOUSE -- CHAPTER ROOM -- NEXT

turns.speaker: KEG PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm so sorry to be bothering you in the middle of the night like this... but it's a bit of an emergency.

turns.speaker: CIGLIUTI
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: KEG PRESIDENT
turns.text: Your son... and your nephew have been kidnapped by these crazy game show hosts from the Fox network. INT. CIGLIUTI COMPOUND -- MASTER BEDROOM -- NEXT Cigliuti sits up in bed.

turns.speaker: CIGLIUTI
turns.text: My Frances? Frances and Charles have been kidnapped? EXT. NEVADA DESERT -- NEXT

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Why the hell are we delivering them out here? I can't even find any warrants in the system for these four.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: The system hasn't been updated.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: The FBI was breathing down Lateesha's neck... and she assumed that they were onto our scam. So she set up some college kids to take the fall for the heist. They have been under FBI surveillance for the past 6 months. INT. CHEVY SUBURBAN Claremont drives like a maniac.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: What happened to them?

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: I don't know. They might be dead already.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: You're breaking up... I can't hear you.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Remove... ... the... right arm.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: What!!?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: I won't forget this, Domino. I'm sorry it turned out like this...

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: She's right... you lost your temper... and you started cursing like some ghetto skank. You lost all credibility right there!

turns.speaker: LATEESHA
turns.text: That bitch called me a bitch.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: I've already formulated a plan.

turns.speaker: LATEESHA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: My armored car business. We just signed a new insurance policy in Nevada. There's a loophole.

turns.speaker: LATEESHA
turns.text: There's always a loophole with you, Claremont. Your black ass is one big loophole. <b> INT. VEGAS SECURITY LOCKDOWN -- [FLASH FORWARD] NIGHT
